oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Blanket of Pvt. Joel S. Crosby of Indiana
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This gray wool blanket has a high content of shoddy fibers and is believed to have been used by by Pvt. Joel S. Crosby, Co. B, 17th Ind. Inf. Regt., USA. Crosby was discharged due to disability November 14,1862, and joined 1st Ind. Hvy. Arty."(also known as the 21st Ind. Arty." The 21st Ind. Arty. Regt., USA, served in the Mobile (Ala.) Campaign, 1864-65. Crosby settled in Spring City, Rhea County (Tenn.) after the war.
